de.esoco.lib.mapping

Class MethodMappingDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.mapping.MethodMappingDefinition

  • public class MethodMappingDefinition
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates a mapping description for methods and method parameters. This allows to implement mappings from certain method calls to others for several purposes, e.g. in proxy classes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String IGNORE
      Target method name constant for a method call that shall be ignored

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MethodMappingDefinition()
      Creates a new default mapping definition (for a 1:1 mapping).
      MethodMappingDefinition(java.util.List<MethodDatatypeMapper> rDatatypeMapping)
      Creates a new definition that contains a 1:1 method mapping and a list of datatype mappers that will be used for all methods.The datatype mappers are searched in the order they appear in the list.
      MethodMappingDefinition(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> rMappingTable)
      Creates a new definition from a map containing method mappings.
      MethodMappingDefinition(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> rMappingTable, java.util.List<MethodDatatypeMapper> rDatatypeMapping)
      Creates a new definition from a map containing method mappings and a list of datatype mappers that will be used for all methods.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MethodMappingDefinition

        public MethodMappingDefinition()
        Creates a new default mapping definition (for a 1:1 mapping).

      • MethodMappingDefinition

        public MethodMappingDefinition(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> rMappingTable)
        Creates a new definition from a map containing method mappings. A mapping consists of the original method name as the key and either the mapped method name or a MethodMappingHandler instance as the value.
        Parameters:
        rMappingTable - The map containing the method mappings (may be NULL)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the map contains an invalid entry

      • MethodMappingDefinition

        public MethodMappingDefinition(java.util.List<MethodDatatypeMapper> rDatatypeMapping)
        Creates a new definition that contains a 1:1 method mapping and a list of datatype mappers that will be used for all methods.The datatype mappers are searched in the order they appear in the list. Therefore, if an implementation needs to distinguish between specific and more generic mappings it must make sure that the more specific mappers come first in the list.
        Parameters:
        rDatatypeMapping - A list of datatype mappers (may be NULL)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the map contains an invalid entry

      • MethodMappingDefinition

        public MethodMappingDefinition(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> rMappingTable,
                               java.util.List<MethodDatatypeMapper> rDatatypeMapping)
        Creates a new definition from a map containing method mappings and a list of datatype mappers that will be used for all methods. A mapping consists of the original method name as the key and either the mapped method name or a MethodMappingHandler instance as the value.

        The datatype mappers are searched in the order they appear in the list. Therefore, if an implementation needs to distinguish between specific and more generic mappings it must make sure that the more specific mappers come first in the list.

        Parameters:
        rMappingTable - A map containing the method mappings (may be NULL)
        rDatatypeMapping - A list of datatype mappers (may be NULL)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the map contains an invalid entry

    • Method Detail

      • getDatatypeMapper

        public MethodDatatypeMapper getDatatypeMapper(java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                                              java.lang.Class<?> rDatatype)
        Checks the global set of datatype mappers if a certain datatype needs conversion and returns the corresponding converter or NULL.
        Parameters:
        rMethod - The method for which the datatype shall be mapped
        rDatatype - The datatype to check for mapping
        Returns:
        The matching datatype mapper or NULL if no mapping is necessary

      • getMappingHandler

        public MethodMappingHandler getMappingHandler(java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod)
        Returns the mapping handler for a particular method.
        Parameters:
        rMethod - The name of the method to map.
        Returns:
        The mapping handler for the method name

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.reflect.Method rOriginalMethod,
                               java.lang.Object rTarget,
                               java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs the method invocation or an equivalent action on the target object and returns the corresponding result. The result's type must match the return type of the method and must be NULL for void methods.

        The default implementation will first invoke mapMethod() to obtain the target method. Then it maps the method arguments by calling mapArguments(). After invoking the mapped method with the converted arguments through reflection it maps the return value by invoking mapReturnValue() and returns it.

        The implementation can signal errors by throwing any kind of exception.

        Parameters:
        rOriginalMethod - The unmapped method that has been invoked
        rTarget - The target object of the method mapping proxy
        rArgs - The arguments of the method call
        Returns:
        The return value of the method call; this must match the return type of the method (NULL for void methods)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any exception may be thrown if either the method invocation or the mapping of arguments or the return value fails

      • merge

        public void merge(MethodMappingDefinition rOther)
        Merges the method and datatype mappings of another mapping definition into this one. Only mappings that don't exist already in this instance will me added, existing mappings won't be changed.
        Parameters:
        rOther - The other mapping to merge into this
